intro: Blephariglottis pallida, commonly known as the pale blephariglottis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in tropical regions. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, pale yellow to white flowers. It typically grows in shaded, humid environments, such as undergrowth in forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in greenhouses or as a houseplant.
